DOC.brief_summary: The aim of the study is to evaluate the severity of dry eye syndrome following excimer laser vision correction using no-touch all-laser photorefractive keratectomy in comparison to conventional lasik
DOC.brief_title: Dry Eye Evaluation After Transepithelial PRK
DOC.detailed_description: Prospective interventional clinical study 2 groups: Group A : 20 eyes of 10 patients undergoing transepithelial PRK Group B: 20 eyes of 10 patients undergoing LASIK using mechanical microkeratome Tear Break Up Time and Schirmer 2 tests are used to evaluate severity of dry eye before surgery and 1 , 3 and 6 months postoperative Follow up period : 6 months
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria Myopia 1 to 6 diopters Astigmatism 0.5 to 4 diopters Pregnancy and lactation Keratoconus Previous refractive surgery Previous herpetic keratitis
DOC.keyword: Dry eye after advanced surface ablation technique
